name: Internships at PUCRS (Automatition)
desc: This was a automation that I developed with Python to get all the opportunities in my university.

name: Login System (API)
desc: I was studying about tokens and Nodejs, than I developed this login system to use in a TodoList app.

name: Chrome Track (Extension)
desc: This is a extension created to Chrome, using Link&Track api. With this extension you can track your ships directly from the browser.

name: TodoList (View)
desc: A page to add, edit and delete things to do daily. I did to practice my front end, than I used the api that I developed previously.

name: TRemover (Windows)
desc: When I was younger, I use to optimize some computers to make some money, most of the time for better results in gaming, and then I decided to create this solution where it deletes and cleans the computer. It saved some time for me.

name: Portfolio Messages (API)
desc: This is a simple api that I developed to get acess to my portfolio messages, since I had a form to send messages in a previously version of my portfolio.

name: BrainRest (Windows)
desc: A pomodoro timer with stats to study, developed with C#, using WinForms, its funny because I still use this app to study.

name: Filmes (API)
desc: This was a test to work for a company that suddently I didn't passed, where it was a simple api CRUD with the data of films, like title, duration and actors.

name: Portfolio (Personal Project)
desc: At this time I finally finished the first version of my portfolio, where I did updated all more 3 times, I started doing all with HTML, CSS and JS, than I migrated to React later and than Angular.

name: Solving Algorithms (Channel on Tiktok)
desc: I started my channel on Tiktok, where I solve algorithms, and post the solution on the channel. I started doing this because I like to discuss and share information, and also because I think that I learn more when I'm teaching someone.

name: Raffle App (Dell IT Academy 2024)
desc: This was the application that got me into the Dell IT Academy, where it was proposed to create an application that simulates a raffle, like Mega Senna, where the user could send numbers, and if all the numbers sorted in the round does matches with the user's numbers, he wins the round. There are a lot of funcionalities in this app, there's a login, to use the application as an administrator and start the rounds and more. There's also a funcionality where it keeps sorting numbers until someone wins the round or reaches 30 numbers sorted, and then no one wins the round. The app does generates a PDF prize to the winner. It was all done with ASP.NET with EF Core, and Angular, theres also a docker compose to run all it once.
